Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: TheBronwyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in the last week of December. We arrived very early in the morning (our flight landed 4am) and we got to the hotel before 6am, the staff very kindly let us use an uncleaned room to get changed and refresh ourselves. The rooms are very small but perfectly fine and clean. The lightrail does go down the road next to the hotel so if early morning noise is a problem this might not be the place for you. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is a short walk to all the major tourist attractions, we walked almost everywhere we needed to from here. We had a lovely time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaysworld
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel close all the best things Istanbul has to offer. Murat the owner ensures your stay is enjoyable and Zafer the night receptionist always ensure your need is met. cant wait to say again at the Old City Viva ! Kay

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: ShadowUZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our trip to Istanbul to celebrate the New Year Eve. And I chose this hotel because of positive feedback of guests at the booking.com. My main criteria for selection were: cleanness, location, price, room size. The hotel booked a room I requested for. BUT, when we arrived, the room was dirty and when I have talked to the reception, they tried to defend their staff, and we didn't expect that. I thought that Turkey is a client oriented, but not in this hotel, I guess. The second day my wife checked the bed frame, which was again dusty. Moreover, the cleaning staff dropped her socks to a dusty floor, which became dirty (that was unpleasant). We didn't tell anything about socks, but dust in the room to the reception. The answer we got: "Nobody complained about that room before (are we the first??)". Finally, after our second complaint, they cleaned up the room properly. And we paid 80 EUR/night, which is quite expensive for such type of hotel in Istanbul (we paid because of a holiday season). We paid 18 EUR for two persons for airport pick up and 10 EUR for two for drop off. The hotel arranged that on our request. Anyway, I had a bad impression about this hotel, although the location is good. Don't stay in that hotel if you care about cleanness in your hotel room! We will never stay there for sure. I will better pay extra money to stay in another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: REHMAN B
Reviews.Content: Oldcity VIVA a Home far away from Home....The location is just superb which links to all the important destinations by walk as you can find a lot of shops,resturants Etc. and once you feel tired you can just hop in the tram and it will bring you very close to VIVA , The Rooms are quite spacious at a reasonable price for that location. The staff were very cooperative who give us an excelent guidance to visit some of the important places, We are extremely thankful to the staff who were really helpful, cooperative & talanted in guideing us to visit some of the most beautiful places in and out of Istanbul, I feel our trip to Istanbul was very successful and I would like to stay in Oldcity Viva during my next visit also. REHMAN BAIG - Doha - Qatar

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: dc15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for its location and price. I stayed twice -- once in mid June for four nights and once in mid July for 1 night. The rooms are simple but clean and the service is friendly. I felt completely safe in this hotel and loved its location -- short walking distance to the tram, short walk to the park and moderate walk to the main sites of the Old City. The only drawback is the ambient noise from outside but this is due more to location than quality of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loud location and not clean”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_vm
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the Hotel, although is located in a great area, the tram goes by in front of the Hotel wich makes it really loud. When we arrived the showers were very dirty full of hair and clogged. Also the toilet had poo! The linens in one of our beds were dirty and when they came to change them they placed new linens and they were also dirty. The cafe downstaris is really nice and gives the impression that the Hotel will be the same, but its total different. For our luck we only had to stay there for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: zee_16
Reviews.Content: our stay at old city viva hotel was unpleasant as the staff of the hotel were not cooperative at all and most of all the breakfast in the morning was just limited, so didnt have much food to eat, and this is why we chose to stay only for 2 days, and later moved to another much better hotel than this. the worst part is that the elevator can only carry either the passengers or the baggage at a time. so this could be a major problem for some on the other hand, the rooms were quite comfy, quite and peaceful with modern furniture, so have no complaints against the rooms :) guys thinking of staying at this hotel, might regret after staying, so choose carefully :)

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Tramway at Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Singh
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is both good and bad. Good, because it's very close to Sirkeci tram station, bad because the rooms facing tramway is noisy during daytime. It's a small family run set up. The rooms are clean and staff are helpful. The lady at the restaurant was goldmine of information, and her tips did help my wife in her shopping adventures. The room has aircon and water is available throughout. The rooms and toilets appear to be recently refurbished, so has feel of newness. We managed to sleep well at night. I found the price of 80 euros on the higher side, since we got a better hotel for 70 euros per nite on our return visit to Istanbul in the same locality.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MichiMadrid
Reviews.Content: My stay in Istanbul was really unforgettable. The location is great, a short walk distance of the most sightseeing places to visit: the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the grand bazaar, the cistern, the spice market... The room made our stay very comfortable. It was kept very clean, which I really appreciated and the bed was very firm and comfortable. Great staff, proffesional, honest and helpful. Downstairs you can find 'MR. DELIGHT' : a modern and chic-decoration-coffee -shop where you can choose between different kind of turkish delights, sweets and pies.They have a take away service which is very useful, also for beverages. I heard that they will open soon a rooftop bar with a wonderful view of the city that is very requested in Istanbul, (and im sure it will be lovely): Quality sevice - price at Oldcity Viva: SIMPLY EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: yogi42
Reviews.Content: We reserved a triple room - couple with grown child. The room was clean, modern and spacious enough. Staff responded immediately to every request. Breakfast was very good even for vegetarians. The hotel provides many services (internet, airport transfers, rooftop deck) that others in the area do not. A driver met us at the airport for the complimentary transfer available with four night stay. We could reach any tourist site and many restaurants from the hotel in five minutes' walk. The only negative was noise at night, both from outside the hotel and within. Make sure you bring ear plugs and all will be well. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great people!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriasSecretAngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Old city Viva hotel with 5 more friends and i must say that was perfect. The location is great. There are many shops in the street of the hotel. You can go on foot to everywhere. The rooms were big enough and very clean. Excellent breakfast! The staff is really nice, kind and helpful. In the hotel there is a new, chic and modern cafe where you can find the famous turkish delights and cakes. Next time i come back to Istanbul, definitely i will stayed at Viva.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jea91
Reviews.Content: Very well situated, walking distance to shopping, restaurants, bars and touristsights. Very attentive waiters, good service, they were always trying to help a maximum. The rooms were ok, bathrooms had enough space. They just finished a bar and coffeeshop downstairs. They are trying to make a hotel with lots of offers. Internet was working, but slow. Breakfast not interesting for europeans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Sirkeci”
Reviews.Author: kirstenmarit
Reviews.Content: newly renovated but small 3p-rooms. Very clean and new towels every day. We liked the breakfast, helpful staff and location!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD service”
Reviews.Author: shardyfoisy
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was awesome. Very well place.Not far from the tram and de port. Alot of restaurant near buy. Good breakfast in the restautrant from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would book in here again”
Reviews.Author: dartsteam
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 friends have just returned from a 4 day stay in the "Old City Viva" hotel, the owners and staff are excellent and are there for YOU nothing was to much trouble for them to make your stay memorable, we all said that we would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to family or friends and if we return to Istanbul this is where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old City Viva Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dartsteam
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us have just returned from staying at the "Old City Viva " Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel was excellent the owners and the staff could not do enough for you. The hotel is situated in the heart of all the main sites to see, so transport is not required. we have all said that we would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to family or friends. we would all return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “we cant stay there”
Reviews.Author: lawinia
Reviews.Content: they cancelled our reservation last day. so when we were on road to go to istanbul we were out of a hotellll.............and they didnt find any other hotel to us.. therefore we cant not make comment about rooms we only know we cant go indside...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Karma_Dharma
Reviews.Content: We found Old City Viva through Trip Advisor and it did not disappoint!! Great location - walking distance from all major attractions, ferry port, train station, old city, etc. Turkish breakfast every morning was excellent. My only complaint would be the thin walls. Otherwise, the staff and their level of service was amazing - they were always friendly, helpful and welcoming. Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Orri
Reviews.Content: The Viva hotel is by far the best option I have found for cheap accomodation in Istanbul. Good location, good service, nice rooms and easy in all ways. I strongly recommend this hotel both for business and pleasure. Doupble room can be had for around 70-80 USD. Restaurant and cafe are good and open to the street so you can enjoy your drink and abosorb the daily action in Istanbul. There are many good restaurants around and no need to use taxi or tram but both pass by and can be used for longer distance. Brilliant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: stokie12
Reviews.Content: just to let people know i stayed for 2 weeks and i would not recomend this hotel to anybody there was no entertainment for kids the only entertainment was at 10.15 just as the all inclusive was just finishing so you could not get a drink before the 10.30 dead line . some staff where helpfull but the bar manager could do whith a lesson in proper people skills ive been back one week now and i am still running the toilet ; you get told not to drink the water but when you have a drink the plastic glasses you get are washed under the tap water and given straight back to you still wet the food was not brilliant unless you like chicken and pasta after 9 years of going to marmaris its the worste place i have ever stayed at so i will never ever go there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: LJ2009London
Reviews.Content: This hotel was still being renovated when I stayed and I got a new room. The room was clean and quite large, lots of storage space and the bed was comfy. Was very good value for what I paid! And the breakfast was probably the best that id had thoughout my trip in turkey. 5 mins walk to all the main sites. Would stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “good quality/price”
Reviews.Author: Saratzika
Reviews.Content: we were 3 persons staying in 2 rooms,one double and one single.The location of the hotel is great even it's verry noisy(it's in the historic center of the city). The rooms were ok with one exception. When we were taking a shower the bathroom got full of water.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back!”
Reviews.Author: los_sz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Viva. It was great. The hotel were just renewed, very modern and comfortable beds. The breakfast was OK. Close to all historic attractions, walking minutes from Aya Sofya, the Topkapi and Archeological Museum. There was a tram stop very close so you could be in Taksim and Beyoglu in just 10 minutes ride. Lots of shops and nice restaurants nearby. When we arrived we thought that the bed sheets weren't clean and they changed it immediately. The staff couldnÂ´t be more helpful and fiendly. The hotel is being renewed, a second part is being added. The rooms on the second part are a little humid, so ask for a room on the front part. I highly recommend this hotel for someone that doesn't want to pay much in Istanbul and is looking for a clean and comfortable little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for The Price”
Reviews.Author: TFAcer
Reviews.Content: First of all i want to thanks the Owners and the employees for there good service they helped s and they were always read for some talk, the rooms are good for the price esspecially a good price for a hotel room in Sirkeci,Istanbul , the location is SuperB its very close to sultanahmet & Aya Sophia,Hippodrom and Cisterna and is 1min far from the tram station who connects you to the rest of European side of Istanbul 1 thing there was much sound when i stayed there they were renovating the hotel im curious how will be at the end and last Thing i recommend this hotel and im sure im going back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Mansoor from Finland- Very Good”
Reviews.Author: apam9
Reviews.Content: We staied in oldcity viva hotel for 8 nights it was unforgettable the hotel is very close to : shopping, big Bazaar ,hitorical place ,the staff, very polite and helpful ,daily cleening, I strongly recommend this hotel to everybody i will come back to hotel viva again ,cheep and nice place. Mansoor from Finland

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: bombon_9
Reviews.Content: I stood with my familly this year for 3 nights in these hotel.We found this hotel very fast, was the first wich we visited and we decided to stood there.Was very beautiful,very clean, i can recomand with the heart oppened to other perssons. We visited many places in istanbul(blue moschee, grand bazzar...).was wonderfull. The hotel perssonal show us a big amability, and this thing impressionated me very much. The hotel is situated in a good zona... I can say you<<Visit this hotel, you will not regrete!..>>

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure about this one”
Reviews.Author: nattygirl
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed views on this one. The room was nice and clean but the bath smelt really bad. The door on the shower kept falling off. I think this is a recently renovated hotel but there were several heavy water markings on the ceilings. The hotel is on a very busy side street so it can be very noisy just about all hours of the day into the evening. Mornings were the worst with heavy drilling going on somewhere in the building. The food in the restaurant is pretty mediocre but the traditional Turkish breakfast was fine. Sitting area outside the hotel offers a break and a chance to soak up the busy environment. I love visiting Istanbul but next time I think I will spring for something a whole lot nicer and would recommend you to do the same. You pay too much for the lack of peace and quiet and a bad stench in the bathroom.

HotelInfo.Name: Old City Viva Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hocapasa Mah. Orhaniye Cad. No:20 | Sirkeci, Istanbul, Turkey
